H0.text: Beak shape is the feature of a bird that the birdwatcher should evaluate first to identify an eastern bluebird.

H1.text: Eye position is the feature a birdwatcher should evaluate first to identify an eastern bluebird.

H2.text: Feather pattern is the feature of a bird that the birdwatcher should evaluate first to identify an eastern bluebird.

H3.text: Tail‑feather length is the first feature a birdwatcher should evaluate when attempting to identify an eastern bluebird.

A4.text: The bright‑blue breeding plumage of the male, easily observed on a wire or open perch, makes this species a favorite of birders.
